title: Brain injury charity slams Wales coach Ryan Giggs' claim that Daniel James was 'acting' in head injury scare
text:
Brain injury charity Headway have hit out at Ryan Giggs’ “shocking” claim that Daniel James was being “streetwise” when he appeared to have been knocked out against Croatia.

They have also accused the Manchester United winger of setting a dangerous example and putting medics under unfair pressure if he was - as Giggs implied - exaggerating the impact of the injury.

James went down alarmingly following a knee-high challenge by Domagoj Vida during Wales’ 1-1 draw on Sunday night and, although the extent of the contact to his head was unclear, he was initially laid motionless on the ground.

That prompted viewers to wonder how a concussion was not at least suspected and how he was not removed from the field of play. James, though, was allowed to complete the game following treatment and an assessment from medics which also included a further half-time check.

Giggs then later said that his player “stayed down with a bit of acting”, adding that he was "a bit streetwise” and "was just using his nous”.
